1636789811_1P4NDknh2sxC5bnnnJWj2EFRHVLKM.body:
Just post it to any appropriate chan on Zeronet using a new ZeroID key (zip up your normal key - user.json I think, then generate another). Post only with that new key. After you've posted your video and are satisfied everything works - destroy that unique key with a full wipe). Unpack your old key and return to normal posting.

Thereafter, your video survives as long as people seed it. No one can delete without your destroyed key. And there is zero provable connection to you. Mission accomplished.

Nation states have the ability to detect internet traffic volume and could conceivable "break" Tor to some extent just by watching volume. But Zeronet secures it's connections with TLS while transferring files with BitTorrent. Can't imagine a more nightmarish situation for nation states than someone using Tor, TLS, and BitTorrent. Only I2P would beat that.Bottom line? You can't be censored. They can't take it down. Only individual Zeronet users can censor you by refusing to seed.

As I see it, 99% of users would censor CP. But most would never censor political speech. Even over the top political speech. So posting on Zeronet puts nation states in an impossible situation. They could only censor by shutting Tor down - because Tor is centralized. Once Zeronet acquires I2P transport - even that possibility goes away.

Did you know that sites on ZeroNet routinely go down? And no one notices because they keep running normally due to seeders? Happened. There are also dead people here. Or sites which were created by no dead people - but still live on.

Some of the newer systems like TaosLFS or IPS may have advantages over Zeronet. but Zeronet is the "little engine that could." Simple often works.

Our biggest problem right now is that monkeywrench the Tor people threw at us with their V2 phaseout. If we can get past that and upgrade to V3 - there is no stopping Zeronet.
